name: Accessibility Practitioner
description: Accessibility Practitioners identify all current and potential user groups and coordinate their participation in the design, development and testing process to ensure that the services created are inclusive.

name: Associate Engineer
description: Solution Engineers design, test and implement solutions that deliver a digital service.

name: Automation Tester
description: Automation Testers construct automated tests which confirm that systems and services function appropriately, and they validate the environment in which these things operate to make sure test results are valid.

name: Business Analyst
description: Business Analysts seek to understanding business processes and determining business requirements for systems.

name: Business Architect
description: Business Architects design and evolve business capabilities in line with the organisation strategy.

name: Chief Architect
description: Chief Architects oversee, steer and develop the entire enterprise architecture of an organisation.

name: Cloud Service Manager
description: Cloud Service Managers monitor cloud usage and work with Cloud Architects and cloud service consumers to ensure cloud service usage is meeting, and can be evolved to better meet, agency objectives. Maintain awareness of cloud service offerings as well as business and customer usage and demands, then advises on, plan and optimises the consumption of cloud services by the agency.

name: Content Designer
familyRole: Content and Useability Design and Testing
description: Content Designers create, curate, organise, layout, evaluate, review and continuously improve the content of a digital service, designed around user needs.

name: Content Strategist
description: Content Strategists develop a content strategy that steers the creation of unambiguous, meaningful, cohesive, engaging, and sustainable content. They focus on the planning, structure, process, creation, delivery, and governance of content.

name: Content Writer
familyRole: Content and Useability Design and Testing
description: Content Writers create, curate, organise, layout, evaluate, review and continuously improve the content of a digital service, designed around user needs.

name: Cyber Advisor
description: Cyber Advisors  provide ICT security advice and assistance to government, including policy creation, project advice and assistance, and research.

name: Cyber Threat Analyst
description: Cyber Threat Analysts need to understand cyber intrusion activities then use their research skills to provide reporting on threat modelling and intelligence.

name: Data Architect
description: Data Architects design, create, deploy and manage the way data will be structured, stored, used, integrated and managed in IT systems.

name: Data Migration Tester
description: Data Migration Testers manage and validate data as it is used or transferred between old and new systems, and within new systems where features of the systems are changing.

name: Delivery Manager
description: Delivery Managers unblock issues, support the delivery team, and monitor and improve performance of the team. They use agile methodologies, learning and iterating the product and processes frequently to meet user needs. They work with Product Managers to define the roadmap for products and services, remove blockers and support the delivery team so that they can maintain delivery throughput.

name: Design Officer
familyRole: Content and Useability Design and Testing
description: Design Officers contribute to the creation, development and improvement of designs for a service.

name: DevOps Engineer
description: DevOps Engineers work closely with development teams to provide (and support) the environment needed to deliver the organisation's services quickly and efficiently, using automation and self-service.

name: Digital Information Architect
description: Digital Information Architects work with Content Strategists and User Researchers to understand the information needs of users and services, in order to design the information architecture supporting a digital service.

name: Engineer
description: Solution Engineers design, test and implement solutions that deliver a digital service.

name: Enterprise Architect
description: Enterprise Architects create and evolve architecture models that inform the design, development and evolution of business processes and supporting ICT systems.

name: Entry Level Business Analyst
description: Business Analysts seek to understanding business processes and determining business requirements for systems.

name: Entry Level Systems Analyst
description: Systems Analysts translate business requirements into technical requirements that align with relevant architectures.

name: Information Architect
description: Information Architects understand, model and design the information requirements and usage of the organisation. They work with other architects to ensure the environment and services within it allow safe and effective management and exploitation of the information holdings of the organisation.

name: Infrastructure Architect
description: Infrastructure Architects design, implement and evolve the infrastructure (on-premises and/or cloud) that support an organisation's IT systems.

name: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Infrastructure Engineers implement, manage and retire the infrastructure (including physical, virtual, networking and cloud infrastructure) that supports digital services.

name: Interaction Designer
description: Interaction Designers research, design and test the scenarios, interaction patterns and interface systems that make up an interaction with a service. They makes decisions based on the evidence of user needs in pursuit of the best service. They prototype and test products/services. They create user journey maps and assist with and participating in user research. They collaborate and manage stakeholders.

name: Junior Automation Tester
description: Automation Testers construct automated tests which confirm that systems and services function appropriately, and they validate the environment in which these things operate to make sure test results are valid.

name: Junior Business Analyst
description: Business Analysts seek to understanding business processes and determining business requirements for systems.

name: Junior Business Architect
description: Business Architects design and evolve business capabilities in line with the organisation strategy.

name: Junior DevOps Engineer
description: DevOps Engineers work closely with development teams to provide (and support) the environment needed to deliver the organisation's services quickly and efficiently, using automation and self-service.

name: Junior Infrastructure Engineer
description: Infrastructure Engineers implement, manage and retire the infrastructure (including physical, virtual, networking and cloud infrastructure) that supports digital services.

name: Junior Research Analyst
description: Research Analysts collect research materials and derive conclusion from those materials to answer specific research questions.

name: Junior Systems Analyst
description: Systems Analysts translate business requirements into technical requirements that align with relevant architectures.

name: Junior Test Analyst
description: Test Analysts determine and then carry out testing activities to validate the design and behaviour of systems and services.

name: Junior User Researcher
description: User Researchers design, organise, participate in and carry out user-centred research. They develop a deep understanding of the users and advocate for recommendations that improve the user's experiences with the service. They use research findings to solve problems for the user and the team/Agency. They may contribute to the creation of prototypes for user testing.

name: Junior Visual Communication Designer
description: Visual Communication Designers interpret information content and create visual representations and/or layouts of that content to aid user consumption. They select and implement the best method of delivering content, including forms of online and off-line publication.

name: Lead Accessibility Advisor
description: Accessibility Advisors identify all current and potential user groups and advocate for service design & development approaches and practices that ensure their needs are taken into account.

name: Lead Business Analyst
description: Business Analysts seek to understanding business processes and determining business requirements for systems.

name: Lead Business Architect
description: Business Architects design and evolve business capabilities in line with the organisation strategy.

name: Lead Content Designer
familyRole: Content and Useability Design and Testing
description: Content Designers create, curate, organise, layout, evaluate, review and continuously improve the content of a digital service, designed around user needs.

name: Lead Content Strategist
description: Content Strategists develop a content strategy that steers the creation of unambiguous, meaningful, cohesive, engaging, and sustainable content. They focus on the planning, structure, process, creation, delivery, and governance of content.

name: Lead Cyber Advisor
description: Cyber Advisors  provide ICT security advice and assistance to government, including policy creation, project advice and assistance, and research.

name: Lead Cyber Threat Analyst
description: Cyber Threat Analysts need to understand cyber intrusion activities then use their research skills to provide reporting on threat modelling and intelligence.

name: Lead Engineer
description: Solution Engineers design, test and implement solutions that deliver a digital service.

name: Lead Incident Responder
description: Incident Responders analyse and investigate a range of complex cyber and information security tasks, including forensic analysis to find sophisticated malicious cyber actors and provide remediation and mitigation advice to protect and secure Australian government systems and networks.

name: Lead Information Architect
description: Information Architects understand, model and design the information requirements and usage of the organisation. They work with other architects to ensure the environment and services within it allow safe and effective management and exploitation of the information holdings of the organisation.

name: Lead Infrastructure Architect
description: Infrastructure Architects design, implement and evolve the infrastructure (on-premises and/or cloud) that support an organisation's IT systems.

name: Lead Interaction Designer
description: Interaction Designers research, design and test the scenarios, interaction patterns and interface systems that make up an interaction with a service. They makes decisions based on the evidence of user needs in pursuit of the best service. They prototype and test products/services. They create user journey maps and assist with and participating in user research. They collaborate and manage stakeholders.

name: Lead Intrusion Analyst
description: Intrusion Analysts identify, track and discover sophisticated malicious cyber activity targeting Australian Government systems and networks.

name: Lead Malware Analyst
description: Malware Analysts identify and understanding malware code, then create code that can defend networks against cyber-attacks.

name: Lead Operations Coordinator
description: Operations Coordinators plan and coordinate incident responses for cyber intrusions affecting Australian Government, industry and networks.

name: Lead Penetration Tester
description: Penetration Testers analyse IT systems to determine configuration weaknesses and faults that would impact on security and business then produce reports detailing the findings and recommendations for improved network security.

name: Lead Security Architect
description: Security Architects design, review, test and assure the technical environment, solution designs and solution implementations in accordance with current and emerging security best practice. They contribute to the technical architecture and security policies and practices.

name: Lead Solution Architect
description: Solution Architects consider the technical and commercial implications of the solution, ensuring it fits with the overall enterprise architecture of the agency. They guide and carry-out the implementation of technology, and maintain an awareness of current and emerging technologies.

name: Lead Systems Analyst
description: Systems Analysts translate business requirements into technical requirements that align with relevant architectures.

name: Lead Technology Architect
description: Technology Architects determine the appropriate technologies to be used in the service development and delivery environment. They monitor emerging technologies and plan technology exploration, implementation and retirement.

name: Lead User Researcher
description: User Researchers design, organise, participate in and carry out user-centred research. They develop a deep understanding of the users and advocate for recommendations that improve the user's experiences with the service. They use research findings to solve problems for the user and the team/Agency. They may contribute to the creation of prototypes for user testing.

name: Lead Vulnerability Assessor
description: Vulnerability Assessors identify, assess and prioritise threat vulnerabilities identified through penetration testing and report findings to improve security architecture and enhance risk awareness.

name: Lead Vulnerability Researcher
description: Vulnerability Researchers perform research on known vulnerabilities and exploits to develop mitigation strategies and tools that can be deployed on network infrastructures, apps and websites.

name: Malware Analyst
description: Malware Analysts identify and understanding malware code, then create code that can defend networks against cyber-attacks.

name: Penetration Tester
description: Penetration Testers analyse IT systems to determine configuration weaknesses and faults that would impact on security and business then produce reports detailing the findings and recommendations for improved network security.

name: Performance Tester
description: Performance Testers examine and report on the responsiveness and stability of systems and their components under workloads.

name: PMO Assurance Officer
description: PMO Assurance Officers assess and report on the delivery of projects, portfolios and programs to ensure that their expected value will be delivered.

name: Portfolio Manager
description: Portfolio Managers oversee the development and execution of a collection of programs, projects and related activities that implement the strategic intent of an organisation.

name: Principal Cyber Advisor
description: Cyber Advisors  provide ICT security advice and assistance to government, including policy creation, project advice and assistance, and research.

name: Principal Cyber Threat Analyst
description: Cyber Threat Analysts need to understand cyber intrusion activities then use their research skills to provide reporting on threat modelling and intelligence.

name: Principal Incident Responder
description: Incident Responders analyse and investigate a range of complex cyber and information security tasks, including forensic analysis to find sophisticated malicious cyber actors and provide remediation and mitigation advice to protect and secure Australian government systems and networks.

name: Principal Intrusion Analyst
description: Intrusion Analysts identify, track and discover sophisticated malicious cyber activity targeting Australian Government systems and networks.

name: Principal Malware Analyst
description: Malware Analysts identify and understanding malware code, then create code that can defend networks against cyber-attacks.

name: Principal Operations Coordinator
description: Operations Coordinators plan and coordinate incident responses for cyber intrusions affecting Australian Government, industry and networks.

name: Principal Penetration Tester
description: Penetration Testers analyse IT systems to determine configuration weaknesses and faults that would impact on security and business then produce reports detailing the findings and recommendations for improved network security.

name: Principal Vulnerability Assessor
description: Vulnerability Assessors identify, assess and prioritise threat vulnerabilities identified through penetration testing and report findings to improve security architecture and enhance risk awareness.

name: Principal Vulnerability Researcher
description: Vulnerability Researchers perform research on known vulnerabilities and exploits to develop mitigation strategies and tools that can be deployed on network infrastructures, apps and websites.

name: Principle Engineer
description: The Principle Engineer has overall responsibility for the technical environment that supports the development and delivery of digital services. They carryout strategic planning to ensure the internal technical environment is always fit for purpose in a continuously evolving external technical environment.

name: Product Manager
description: Product Managers work closely with User Researchers and the rest of the delivery team to create and improve a product or service, ensuring it meets user needs. They are responsible for prioritising product component delivery, according to greatest user needs.

name: Product Owner
description: Product Owners work closely with User Researchers and the rest of the delivery team to create and improve a product or service, ensuring it meets user needs. They are responsible for prioritising product component delivery, according to greatest user needs.

name: Program Manager
description: Program Managers coordinate the delivery of multiple related projects and other change activities, which may include business-as-usual activities.

name: Project Manager
description: Project Managers plan and manage the delivery of projects.

name: Project Officer
description: Project Officers assist in the operations of a Project/Program/Portfolio Office and the delivery of projects.

name: Project Support Officer
description: Project Officers assist in the operations of a Project/Program/Portfolio Office and the delivery of projects.

name: Quantitative Research Analyst
description: Quantitative Researchers investigate and quantify the opinions, attitudes, behaviours, etc. of groups of people in order to uncover patterns in behaviour, motivation, preferences etc. that can inform the improvement of government services.

name: Quantitative Researcher
description: Quantitative Researchers investigate and quantify the opinions, attitudes, behaviours, etc. of groups of people in order to uncover patterns in behaviour, motivation, preferences etc. that can inform the improvement of government services.

name: Research Designer
description: Research Designers plan and oversee the specific research activities of an organisation or group, specifying the methodology and approach that will be used for each research activity and ensuring it is used appropriately.

name: Research Support Officer
description: Research Support Officers provide support and assistance to researchers, including carrying out research activities and drafting reports.

name: Risk Manager
description: Risk Managers identify, evaluate and prioritise risks and opportunities, and then coordinate mitigation strategies, monitor and report on the risks.

name: Scrum Master
description: Scrum Masters support the delivery team, and monitor and improve performance of the team. They use agile methodologies, learning and iterating the product and processes frequently to meet user needs. They work with Delivery Managers to remove blockers and support the delivery team so that they can maintain delivery throughput.

name: Security Architect
description: Security Architects design, review, test and assure the technical environment, solution designs and solution implementations in accordance with current and emerging security best practice. They contribute to the technical architecture and security policies and practices.

name: Senior Automation Tester
description: Automation Testers construct automated tests which confirm that systems and services function appropriately, and they validate the environment in which these things operate to make sure test results are valid.

name: Senior Business Analyst
description: Business Analysts seek to understanding business processes and determining business requirements for systems.

name: Senior Cyber Advisor
description: Cyber Advisors  provide ICT security advice and assistance to government, including policy creation, project advice and assistance, and research.

name: Senior Cyber Threat Analyst
description: Cyber Threat Analysts need to understand cyber intrusion activities then use their research skills to provide reporting on threat modelling and intelligence.

name: Senior DevOps Engineer

description: Solution Engineers design, test and implement solutions that deliver a digital service.

name: Senior Performance Tester
description: Performance Testers examine and report on the responsiveness and stability of systems and their components under workloads.

name: Senior Project Manager
description: Project Managers plan and manage the delivery of projects.

name: Senior Project Officer
description: Project Officers assist in the operations of a Project/Program/Portfolio Office and the delivery of projects.

name: Senior Service Designer
familyRole: Content and Useability Design and Testing
description: Service Designers research, prototype and test service deigns, create customer journey maps and carryout stakeholder management.

name: Senior Systems Analyst
description: Systems Analysts translate business requirements into technical requirements that align with relevant architectures.

name: Senior Test Analyst
description: Test Analysts determine and then carry out testing activities to validate the design and behaviour of systems and services.

name: Senior Visual Communication Designer
description: Visual Communication Designers interpret information content and create visual representations and/or layouts of that content to aid user consumption. They select and implement the best method of delivering content, including forms of online and off-line publication.

name: Senior Vulnerability Researcher
description: Vulnerability Researchers perform research on known vulnerabilities and exploits to develop mitigation strategies and tools that can be deployed on network infrastructures, apps and websites.

name: Service Designer
familyRole: Content and Useability Design and Testing
description: Service Designers research, prototype and test service deigns, create customer journey maps and carryout stakeholder management.

name: Solution Architect
description: Solution Architects consider the technical and commercial implications of the solution, ensuring it fits with the overall enterprise architecture of the agency. They guide and carry-out the implementation of technology, and maintain an awareness of current and emerging technologies.

name: Systems Analyst
description: Systems Analysts translate business requirements into technical requirements that align with relevant architectures.

name: Technology Architect
description: Technology Architects determine the appropriate technologies to be used in the service development and delivery environment. They monitor emerging technologies and plan technology exploration, implementation and retirement.

name: Test Analyst
description: Test Analysts determine and then carry out testing activities to validate the design and behaviour of systems and services.

name: Test Lead
description: Test Leads manage testing activities for a project or service, usually leading a team of testers and providing high-level testing expertise.

name: Test Manager
description: Test Managers oversee the whole testing practice and manage the deployment of testing resources and testing approaches.

name: User Researcher
description: User Researchers design, organise, participate in and carry out user-centred research. They develop a deep understanding of the users and advocate for recommendations that improve the user's experiences with the service. They use research findings to solve problems for the user and the team/Agency. They may contribute to the creation of prototypes for user testing.

name: User Researcher Director
description: User Researcher Directors oversee the user-centred research discipline within an organisation. They ensure the user research practice develops a deep understanding of the users and uses that research to improve the user's experience.

name: Visual Communication Designer
description: Visual Communication Designers interpret information content and create visual representations and/or layouts of that content to aid user consumption. They select and implement the best method of delivering content, including forms of online and off-line publication.

name: Vulnerability Assessor
description: Vulnerability Assessors identify, assess and prioritise threat vulnerabilities identified through penetration testing and report findings to improve security architecture and enhance risk awareness.

name: Vulnerability Researcher
description: Vulnerability Researchers perform research on known vulnerabilities and exploits to develop mitigation strategies and tools that can be deployed on network infrastructures, apps and websites.
